column1: Antioxidants are substances that help to prevent cell damage.

The following microgreens have higher amounts of certain vitamins than their adult forms: - Red cabbage -- Vitamin C - Green daikon radish -- Vitamin E - Cilantro -- Carotenoids (antioxidants that can turn into vitamin A) - Garnet amaranth -- Vitamin K Eating lots of fruits and vegetables in any form is good for you.
Although it is not well-proven, a healthy diet rich in fruits and vegetables may reduce the risk of cancer and other chronic diseases.
Vitamin K can affect how these medicines work.
